title: Handling missing data
postscript: Earlier you learned about the index() method of arrays, which returns the position of an item inside an array. This actually returns an optional position, because the item might not be in the array.
question: Which of these make good candidates for optionals?
hint: Optionals are useful when you might not know some information or it might not exist.
correct: The position of an item in an array.
Someone's birthday if you know it.
The capital city of a country your user just typed in.
The current destination of a car's satellite navigation system.
The year a user last went on a boat.
wrong: An array of all languages spoken in your country.
The number of pages in a book.
The international dialling code for a country.
